title: (x) Street names on Google Maps - Arial {Stephen}
content:
Does anyone know what font Google Maps uses for the street names?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Googlemapssampletext2.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203216/http:/typophile.com/files/Googlemapssampletext2.JPG) | 217.88 KB |
| [Googlemapssampletext.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203216/http:/typophile.com/files/Googlemapssampletext.jpg) | 14.48 KB |

 [‹ (x) Hershey's Chocolate logo compact sans - Helvetica Utra Compressed {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50324 "Go to previous forum topic") [Suggestions for Cute Font. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50233 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wilson735

comments.content: When I type out the name of the same street, for example, in Photoshop and place it next to the original, they do not look alike. The one in the Google Maps seems to be longer (lengthwise) and they just don’t match up. Is there a specific setting to the Arial?
Hmm, I don’t know what else it could be. It’s certainly not Helvetica.
